solution_line_template: Louise has {red_pencils} red pencils * {blue_multiplier} = <<{red_pencils}*{blue_multiplier}={blue_pencils}>>{blue_pencils} blue pencils.
She therefore has {red_pencils} red pencils + {blue_pencils} blue pencils = <<{red_pencils}+{blue_pencils}={green_pencils}>>{green_pencils} green pencils.

In total, she has {red_pencils} red pencils + {blue_pencils} blue pencils + {green_pencils} green pencils + {yellow_pencils} yellow pencils = <<{red_pencils}+{blue_pencils}+{green_pencils}+{yellow_pencils}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} pencils.
As each box holds {pencils_per_box} pencils, she needs {total_pencils} pencils / {pencils_per_box} pencils/box = <<{total_pencils}/{pencils_per_box}={num_boxes}>>{num_boxes} boxes.
